Author: jj
Comment:
Please reject this patch!
The assumption that either the top left corner (or bottom right corner) of a window is always placed within some output is wrong, e.g.: you could actually resize a window to be bigger than the whole screen. The detection of the current output also feels like a workaround. Is there some nicer way to get the current output of some window?

Author: Michael Stapelberg
Comment: Have a look at floating_maybe_reassign which handles changing outputs (workspaces to be precise) when moving a floating window.
